snippet.title: Robin Finseth: Demystifying Clairvoyance
snippet.description:
Presented on March 23rd, 2017

Clairvoyance is often considered a level of spiritual awareness. In reality, however, sensory perception is connected directly to self-awareness. That is, clairvoyance is more about being aware of one's self in the world, rather than being aware of outside spiritual activity. Born with the gift of clairvoyant sight, Robin will discuss practical steps to achieving a better understanding of our fellow man and what it means to be living in this world we call home, which often leads to a happier existence.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3306&search=Demystifying+Clairvoyance&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd---Theosophy: A Spiritual Legacy for Humanity
snippet.description:
Presented on March 2, 2017

In Theosophical circles, we often tend to look to our past for guidance and inspiration. However, the essence of Theosophy is its relevance to life as it is being lived in the present. While we can learn from the past, it is the quality of our present actions that help shape the world we live in. To live a spiritual life is to make a positive and uplifting contribution to the well-being of humanity regardless of our particular role or position in the world. This is the timeless legacy of Theosophy.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3290&search=Theosophy%3A+A+Spiritual+Legacy+for+Humanity&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Santikaro: Revealing Reality through Mindful Inquiry
snippet.description:
Presented on February 23, 2017

Meditation and spiritual practice cultivate skillful attentiveness within all aspects of life, along with a deepening inquiry into what is actually going on. Many of our views are based on beliefs arising from habit and muddled motivation, so we must ask ourselves whether each of our beliefs is valid. Buddhist teachings advise ongoing reflection to achieve this purpose. Explore the crucial role of inquiry within the spiritual path as we learn to pay more attention, focus on what's important, and look even more deeply within.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3287&search=Revealing+Reality&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Pablo Sender: The Problem of Evil
snippet.description:
Presented on October 23, 2014

One of the main mysteries in the philosophy of religion is the existence of evil and suffering in a universe that is supposed to be created and ruled by an omnipotent, omniscient, and benevolent God. How can this apparent paradox be explained? Assuming that evil and suffering are wrong, some conclude that God does not exist, while others postulates that evil is the outcome of humanity’s misuse of the free will given by God. Is there a Theosophical perspective?

snippet.title: Azam Nizamuddin - The Spiritual Poetry of Rumi: The Language of Love
snippet.description:
Presented on February 16, 2017

Jelaluddin Rumi, the 13th-century Persian poet, was one of the most profound poets in history. He is one of the most widely read poets in the U.S. and is considered by many to be the greatest mystical poet of all time. His words seem to touch the indescribable and ineffable nature of the divine, and show that beauty is an essential component of religion and faith. Azam will share a selection of Rumi’s poems to explore how themes of love, tolerance and compassion stem from his attempts to incorporate his faith into his own life and teachings.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3284&search=Spiritual+Poetry+of+Rumi&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: The Dalai Lama - Building Bridges: Religious Leaders in Conversation with the Dalai Lama
snippet.description:
Presented on July 18, 2011

In this panel discussion, which was sponsored by The Theosophical Society in America, His Holiness joins various religious leaders in discussing how the world's problems can be addressed in a more effective way if religions put aside their differences and work together. The Dalai Lama joins Rabbi Michael Lerner, founding editor of the progressive Jewish interfaith magazine "Tikkun," which is dedicated to building bridges between religious and secular organizations; Dr. Ingrid Mattson, Hartford Seminary Professor of Islamic Studies and Christian-Muslim Relations; and Rev. Peg Chemberlin, executive director of the Minnesota Council of Churches in a panel discussion entitled “Building Bridges: Religious Leaders in Conversation with the Dalai Lama.”  The panel was moderated by Eboo Patel, the founder and executive director of the Interfaith Youth Core, a Chicago-based international nonprofit that aims to promote interfaith cooperation.

theosophical.org

snippet.title: Hazel Archer-Ginsberg: Mysteries of the Celtic Goddesses
snippet.description:
Presented on February 9th, 2017

Celtic mythology was passed on orally by Druid priests, and worship of Celtic Goddesses was discouraged by the Romans and Christians. However, many Celtic figures were integrated into the new culture, and the resurgence of Druid and Pagan movements has sparked interest in Celtic goddesses. Learn how goddesses like the trifold goddess Brigid, with her powers of Fire of Inspiration, Hearth, and Forge, is celebrated today.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3281&search=Mysteries+of+the+Celtic&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Don Myers: The Dissolving Methods of Lao Tzu's Water Meditation Tradition
snippet.description:
Presented on February 2, 2017

The Tao Te Ching says, “Nothing in this world is as soft and yielding as water. Yet for dissolving the hard and inflexible, nothing can surpass it.” Dissolving practices embody this spiritual principle. In Outer Dissolving, the mind's intent is used to release tension and pain from your physical and etheric (qi) bodies. Deeper Inner Dissolving can free blockages in the higher energy bodies (emotional, mental, psychic, karmic), and results in what the Taoists call “Relaxing Into Your ‘Being’” – the heart-mind (hsin), or, soul.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3278&search=Dissolving+Methods&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Does a Fish See Water? An Intro. to the Holographic Mind | Sensei Mui
snippet.description:
Presented on January 26, 2017

A fish lives in water and perceives it as nothing unusual, because it is unusual for the fish to be out of water. Humankind is similar. We live in a hologram – meaning each part contains within it the information for the whole – but how can we really know unless we step out of it? This is the nature of the holographic mind and the universe it creates. The idea of the holographic mind was described in detail over 2,500 years ago in Buddhist and Vedic literature. Sensei Mui will compare this wisdom of the past with recent scientific discoveries.

The views expressed in this program are those of the presenter/s and do not necessarily represent the views of the Theosophical Society in America, its members, or its affiliates.

snippet.title: James Phillips: Pharaoh Akhenaten and the Sacred Wisdom of Ancient Egypt
snippet.description:
Presented on January 19, 2017

Over 3,500 years ago, Egyptian Pharaoh Akhenaten had a dream for a world where all peoples lived in peace, were equal under the law, and freely offered services to each other. Believing passionately in the myth of Zep Tepi, a time when enlightened semi-divine beings shared wisdom with early Egyptians and taught that all things are One, he reintroduced this spiritual philosophy for the betterment of his people. Learn more about these ancient teachings and find out whether Akhenaten was able to achieve his goal.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3272&search=Pharaoh+Akhenaten&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Shantal Alonso - Mindful Parenting: A Foundation for Healthy Family Relations
snippet.description:
Presented on January 12, 2017

In order to teach our children how to navigate life’s challenges with mindfulness, equanimity and wisdom, we must first cultivate these traits within ourselves. The ripple effects of our emotions impact the family as a whole. We will explore some fundamentals of brain science to see how the practice of mindfulness helps re-wire our habitual responses and break unhealthy patterns, leading to more positive and healthy family interactions.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3269&search=Mindful+Parenting&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Dave Gunning: Karmic Lessons and the Ascending Sign
snippet.description:
Presented on January 5, 2017

While most of us are familiar with astrology relating to our sun sign, there is also much to be gained from understanding your ascending sign, which is based on the month, day, and time of birth. Your ascending sign can provide valuable insight about your attitude towards life and even your physical appearance! It also holds a life lesson. Discover how the evolution of these signs reflects our spiritual evolution and learn about the qualities and virtues of each sign.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3266&search=Karmic+Lessons&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Huston Smith: A Life of Exploring Religious Frontiers
snippet.description:
Presented on April 18, 2002 in Chicago, Illinois.

Professor Huston Smith passed away on Friday December 30th, 2016 at the age of 97. We remember his life and work by posting this video lecture of him recounting the oftentimes surprising and unpredictable causes and consequences of a life of religious exploration. Following his main talk, Professor Smith commented on a television interview he had conducted years earlier with the well-known philosopher, speaker, and writer Jiddu Krishnamurti.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=1135&search=Huston+Smith&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

#HustonSmith #religion #comparativereligion

snippet.title: Ray Grasse: The Spirit of Place
snippet.description:
Presented on December 15, 2016

Spiritual traditions around the world have long spoken of the distinctive character and subtle energies unique to each environment. What exactly is "the spirit of place," and how does it impact our lives and psyches? In turn, how do our actions, thoughts, and structures modify the energies of place? Ray will address various aspects of this relationship, while also exploring the possibility of a synchronistic connection between human experience and the natural world.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3242&search=Spirit+of+Place&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Bill Epperly - Centering Prayer: A Contemplative Path to Divine Union
snippet.description:
Presented on December 8, 2016

The Christian contemplative tradition contains many hidden gems, such as the contemplative practice known as Centering Prayer, developed in the 1970s by three Trappist monks. The practice of Centering Prayer leads to communion with the Ultimate Mystery in silence and a resting in God beyond words and concepts. This results in healing, transformation and, ultimately, Divine Union. Bill Epperly, Ph.D. is an adjunct faculty member at Loyola University where he teaches mindfulness for pastoral counselors. His Website is www.integralawakenings.com.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3237&search=Centering+Prayer&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: John Cianciosi: The Power of Mindfulness
snippet.description:
The Buddha said that mindfulness is beneficial in every aspect of life, so it is not surprising that today we find it being taught to promote physical, mental, and emotional well-being. However, mindfulness itself is not a sufficient factor for the arising of peace and wisdom, and there have been reports of people experiencing adverse results when practicing mindfulness. We will discuss the conditions necessary to achieve a successful and beneficial mindfulness practice. Presented on December 1, 2016.


*****************************
Learn more

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/search&search=Power%20of%20Mindfulness&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Danelys Valcarcel: Intuitive Living as a Spiritual Path
snippet.description:
Presented on November 17, 2016

Every human being has an inner sense of knowing called intuition. It functions as an aspect of the soul and grows in proportion to the use we make of it. We will discuss the nature of intuition and gain practical advice on how to healthfully stimulate the functioning of this higher capacity in each of us so that it can pervade the whole of our daily lives.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3231&search=Intuitive&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: William Wester: Exploring 14 Billion Years of Cosmic History
snippet.description:
Presented on November 10, 2016

The Big Bang theory defines modern cosmology. Today, scientists are in virtually uniform agreement that the universe has expanded over the past approximately 14 billion years from a hot and dense state. Dan will discuss the Big Bang theory along with observations and measurements that have left the scientific community convinced of its validity.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3225&search=Big+Bang&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Evan Moffic: The Jewishness of Jesus
snippet.description:
Presented on November 3, 2016

The life and ministry of Jesus are among the most well-known stories in the world. Rabbi Moffic will explore how Jesus’ Jewishness shaped this ministry and message. Looking at Jesus’ life, death and teachings from this perspective provides a new understanding of the Lord's Prayer, the meaning of “messiah,” and the parables. We come to appreciate how radical Jesus’ teachings were, why miracles were unimaginable, and what uncompromising love he proclaimed. 

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3222&search=Jewishness+of+Jesus&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Orgyen Chowang Rinpoche - Our Pristine Mind: A Tibetan Guide to Unconditional Happiness
snippet.description:
Presented on August 20, 2016

An exploration of Tibetan Buddhist meditation practices that purify the mind and can lead one to a transcendent state of happiness in the midst of life's many challenges.

snippet.title: Nancy Hill: Writing as a Spiritual Path
snippet.description:
Presented on October 27, 2016

The purpose of a spiritual path is to bring us fully into the moment, to be aware of our soul story, and ultimately to connect with the Great Mysterious. Nancy will show us a way to express through writing what our five senses notice in each moment, and how this spiritual practice can help us experience life more deeply.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3220&search=Writing+as+a+Spiritual+Path&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Bhante Sujatha: Tame Your Ego and Find True Happiness
snippet.description:
Presented on October 20, 2016

The Buddha taught that a truly meaningful life is found at the center of things, on the middle path. It is usually in the highs and lows that suffering prevails. Keeping Ego in check and understanding how it emerges to influence a situation is a highly beneficial awareness that will yield powerful results and increased joy. Ego does serve a purpose in helping us live confident and effective lives. Only when we have too much or too little do we suffer. When we tame Ego, we find true happiness.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3218&search=Tame+Your+Ego+and+Find+True+Happiness&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Janet Wehr: The Essence of Healing
snippet.description:
Presented on October 13, 2016

More and more often we hear about the importance of the mind-body-spirit connection in healing. Janet will discuss how each of us can take steps to assist in our own healing by recognizing barriers and obstacles that we consciously and unconsciously harbor. Overcoming these impediments and making positive lifestyle changes can only lead to enhancing our general health.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3216&search=Essence+of+Healing&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Don Myers: Introduction to Dragon and Tiger Medical Qigong
snippet.description:
Presented on October 6, 2016

Dragon and Tiger Medical Qigong originated 1,500 years ago at the Shaolin Chan Buddhist Monastery, but also has Taoist roots. Widely practiced in China, it is one of the two qigong systems most commonly used by cancer patients. Its seven gentle movements activate and balance all the major acupuncture meridians, while enhancing flexibility, performance, and healing.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3205&search=Introduction+to+Dragon+and+Tiger&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Samadhi Donna Banks - Vital Life Force: Inviting Awareness and Potential into Your Life
snippet.description:
Presented on September 29, 2016

Learn about the vital life force known as Kundalini and explore the basis of Tantric philosophy. Get an introduction to the aura and chakras in relation to the Kundalini energy, and tune into a higher degree of individual and interpersonal energetic awareness. Through this process, you will learn how to begin tapping your deeper potential to release inhibitions and limitations from your life.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3202&search=Vital+Life+Force&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: The Importance of Center
snippet.description:
Presented on September 22, 2016

In geometric figures, gravitational patterns, conscious life forms, and human social and political structures, the center and centering are of vital importance. Unfoldment of deeper potentials of consciousness depends on our ability to be aware of, then function through progressively more refined "centers" within us. The Ageless Wisdom tradition gives guidance in this process.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3199&search=The+Importance+of+Center&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Azam Nizamuddin - The Philosophy of Rumi: Love and Peace in Islamic Spirituality
snippet.description:
Presented on September 15, 2016

Rumi was a 13th-century Persian poet, Islamic scholar, theologian and Sufi mystic. His influence transcends national borders and ethnic divisions, and he is considered one of the most popular poets in the United States. Professor Nizamuddin will discuss Rumi's contribution to Islamic theology and Western philosophy and share some of his most significant poetry.

snippet.title: Panel - Inspiration, Influence, Implications: The Legacy of H. P. Blavatsky
snippet.description:
Presented on July 19, 2016

The visionary insights of Helena P. Blavatsky (1831-91) radically impacted the consciousness of truth seekers in the Western world and directly inspired the work of artists, writers, philosophers, and scientists who themselves went on to profoundly affect global consciousness. This panel discussion, given at the 130th Summer National Convention of the Theosophical Society in America, features Doss McDavid, Stephan Hoeller, Michael Gomes, Ed Abdil, and Trân-Thi-Kim-Diêu. Moderator for the panel is Tim Boyd, president of the Theosophical Society in America.

snippet.title: Joy Mills: A Life in the Service of Theosophy
snippet.description:
Presented on July 16, 2016

Produced by Steve Schweizer, this short video remembers the life and work of Theosophist Joy Mills (1920-2015). Having joined the Theosophical Society in 1940 at the young age of 20, she would go on to serve in almost every major office and educational capacity available in the Society, both from within the U. S. and internationally. Told in Joy's own words and edited from 3 different video interviews conducted with her from 1999 to 2012, this video looks at only some of her amazing achievements and the Theosophical legacy that she leaves behind.

snippet.title: Rabbi Douglas Goldhamer: Spiritual Laws and the Kabbalah
snippet.description:
Presented on May 26, 2016

Jewish Kabbalah believes that before God created the world, He first created the primordial Torah, which contains all the spiritual laws of the universe. By developing an understanding of these spiritual laws, we can strengthen and grow a personal relationship with God. And when we adhere to them, we can open up blockages between soul and body, and receive God’s blessings from on high.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3113&search=the+Kabbalah&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Lydia Van den Broeck - Master Your Energy: Self-Love Opens the Door
snippet.description:
Presented on June 16, 2016

Self-love is one of the most important methods for mastering our energy, but it can be difficult to express when we’re bogged down with heavy emotions and feelings. However, what we often experience as a “feeling” is simply energy asking to be released and grounded authentically. Learn how to open your crown and heart chakras so your creativity and manifestations can become real and tangible!

For more information,  please direct your inquiries to lydia@lydiavandenbroeck.com, or phone 630-792-9020.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3119&search=Master+Your+Energy%3A+Self-love&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Vimala Bhikkhuni - The Buddha's Teaching of No-Self: Letting Go of Limiting Beliefs
snippet.description:
Presented on June 23, 2016

One of the first stumbling blocks that Westerners encounter when they learn about Buddhism is the teaching of anatta, often translated as no-self. Vimala will share her insights and understanding regarding this core teaching of Buddhism and show its relevance in our daily lives. By using these teachings, we will let go of our fears and limiting beliefs so we can live happier, more peaceful lives.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3125&search=Buddha%27s+Teaching+of+No&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Oksana Gritsenko: Understanding Our Dreams
snippet.description:
Presented on June 16, 2016

We all dream all the time. Dreams are the messages from our subconscious mind – some even say messages from our Soul – and are very important. If you learn to understand the meaning of those messages, you will understand the guidance of your inner Self. Oksana will help you learn why your dreams are so important and how by remembering and interpreting your dreams you can gain more clarity about your waking life.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3122&search=Understanding+Our+Dreams&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Pablo Sender: Finding the Eternal
snippet.description:
Presented June 2, 2016

Are we just our transient bodies and minds? While science is unable to answer this question, spiritual philosophies and religions postulate that we are far more than this, and that the purpose of life is to discover our true identity, which transcends time and space. Pablo Sender will explore some concepts and practical exercises that can help us in our quest to discover our eternal nature. 

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3116&search=Finding+the+Eternal&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Vincent Pitisci - Genius of the Tarot: Breaking Open the Mystery
snippet.description:
The Tarot has fascinated people for centuries, but no one has been able to satisfactorily explain how or why the cards work. Vincent Pitisci draws the curtain aside to reveal not only how to use Tarot cards, but also how this ingenious system works by creating a way of thinking and seeing that cannot be achieved through our conventional, conditioned thought process.   

Visit his website at www.tarotmaps.com

Books: 
Genius of the Tarot - https://amzn.to/3jO8Uy7
The Essential Tarot: Unlocking the Mystery - https://amzn.to/31OPwdV

Presented on May 19, 2016 at The Theosophical Society in America in Wheaton, IL.

snippet.title: Quentin Young - The Fate of Humanity: Black Elk Speaks
snippet.description:
Presented on May 12, 2016

In 1872 on the plains of Montana, a nine-year-old Lakota boy named Black Elk embarked on a journey to the spirit world. There he met the Six Grandfathers, recognized as the powers of the world, who revealed to him the fate of humanity. Quentin will discuss his book Mystic Visions: Black Elk's Great Vision Clarified, and present an overview of Lakota traditions with respect to Black Elk’s Great Vision and how this vision applies to the world as a whole.

snippet.title: Bill Epperly - The Integral Path to Enlightenment: Evolutionary Spirituality
snippet.description:
Presented on May 5, 2016

Ken Wilber’s integral map of human consciousness is an evolving model with important implications for our understanding of spiritual life and awakening. In the integral view, every moment and aspect of life is seen as a potential place of practice, a moment of encounter with Spirit. This presentation will outline Wilber’s map of consciousness and suggest how to engage with all aspects of your life (self, body, relationships and society) in embodied spiritual practice.

snippet.title: Don Myers - From Movement Comes Stillness: Tai Chi and Meditation
snippet.description:
Presented on April 28, 2016

The meditative movements of tai chi are excellent preparatory and complimentary mind-body methods to support meditation practice from any tradition. Tai chi can provide a bridge to and foundation for meditation – cultivating a relaxed body, strong internal energy (qi), emotional stability, and a focused mind. Don will discuss the moving mode of Taoist meditation utilizing Wu style tai chi in lieu of more ancient long qigong forms.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3100&search=From+Movement+Comes+Stillness&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: Reversing the Flow: A Conscious Choice
snippet.description:
Presented on April 21, 2016

Our normal experience is that change is constant, but making personal change can be difficult. The inner qualities we most need – peacefulness, clarity, and wisdom – seem to be in opposition with the world around us. The Ageless Wisdom tradition gives insight into the process of inner change and our potential to affect the world around us.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3097&search=Reversing+the+Flow&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Juliette Looye: The Transformative Power of Feng Shui
snippet.description:
Presented on  April 14, 2016

The ancient Chinese developed feng shui by observing nature to understand the harmony of all life. In nature, they sensed an energy that flowed through all things, bringing transformation and balance. Today, we practice feng shui indoors to create the same balance found in nature. Juliette discusses how to use feng shui to turn your home into a welcoming and peaceful oasis that supports your health and well-being. 

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3094&search=Transformative+Power+of+Feng+Shui&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Donna Adler - John of the Cross: A Counter-Reformation Christian Mystic
snippet.description:
Presented on March 31, 2016

Follow the tale of the soul's transformation in St. John of the Cross’s celebrated poem, The Living Flame of Love. The spiritual journey described reveals something about the relationship of happiness to goodness; the necessity of detachment from self; the proper order and meaning of love for neighbor in a framework presuming a committed overarching love of God; and the intimate link between the transformation of the self in goodness and the transformation of human society into a humane society embodying the good as a dedicated work in progress.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3071&search=John+the+Cross&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: John Cianciosi: Mindfulness, Bliss and Beyond
snippet.description:
Ajahn Brahm is a living Buddhist master who has inspired a large and fast-growing international following with his clear and profound teachings on the experience of deep meditation and the insights that lead to enlightenment. In his book, Mindfulness, Bliss, and Beyond, he presents the ancient Buddhist teachings in a bold and powerful way as only one who has walked the path can do. John will explore these teachings to find inspiration for our own Spiritual Quest. Presented on March 24, 2016.


*****************************
Learn more

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3068

Books
The Meditative Path: A Gentle Way to Awareness, Concentration, and Serenity https://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=742

snippet.title: Juliette Looye - The Akashic Records: A Powerful Tool for Expanding Awareness
snippet.description:
Presented on March 17, 2016

The Akashic Records refer to impressions of past events and experiences that exist on non-physical planes. Juliette will discuss how having access to these records can help us step outside the frame of our limited human perspective to gain the soul-level picture of who we are and why we are here. She also will describe how learning to view life from an Akashic perspective helps us navigate even the most difficult situations with clarity and grace.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3065&search=Akashic+Records%3A+A+Powerful&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Janet Wehr: Living with Dying
snippet.description:
Presented on March 10, 2016

Western society often ignores the subject of death, and conversations about it are frequently uncomfortable and stressful. While many milestones of life are approached with anticipation and preparation, this final one is often avoided. However, one can experience a “good death” at the end of this earthly journey. By sharing stories from her newly released book, Peaceful Passages: A Hospice Nurse's Stories of Dying Well, Janet will guide us and those we love through the spiritual experience of death.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3062&search=Living+with+Dying&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Santikaro - Engaged Spirituality: Can We Save Ourselves without Saving the World?
snippet.description:
Presented on March 3, 2016

Spirituality and worldliness are often treated as a dichotomy. In contrast to shunning one for the sake of the other, "engaged spirituality" sees caring for society and the world as an expression of wisdom and compassion. This talk will consider Buddhist teachings that support this approach to holistic and integrated spirituality.

snippet.title: James Phillips - Secrets of Adepts: An Introduction
snippet.description:
Presented on February, 25, 2016

At this “taster” for the Secrets of the Adepts Workshop, you will be given secret knowledge possessed by the old Egyptian djedi, made famous in the Star Wars movies, about the true purpose of pyramids and why the Adepts became so accomplished in the production of piezoelectricity. Experience the 24-minute Heart Initiation which will rejuvenate your personal source of loving energy and expand your ability to experience unconditional love.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3055&search=Secrets+of+Adepts&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: Overcoming Fear
snippet.description:
Presented on February 18, 2016

The internal experience of fear is common to all people. Like all emotional states fear is energetic in nature, and in the absence of deeper examination, it can be crippling. The Ageless Wisdom teachings give sound advice on dealing with this universal experience. Although it is the rare person who can say that he or she is completely without fear, it is possible for us to learn how to recognize the energies as they arise and then redirect them.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3021&search=Overcoming+Fear&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Richard Smoley: What Is Love?
snippet.description:
Love may be the single most mysterious force in human life. In this talk, Richard Smoley will use insights from his book "Conscious Love" to explore the role that love actually plays in the universe and in our consciousness. He’ll also discuss how to work with love on the spiritual path. Presented February 11, 2016.


*****************************
Learn more

snippet.title: Glenn Mullin - Healing through Meditation, Mantra, and Color Therapy: Part 1 - Introduction
snippet.description:
Presented on February 5, 2016

This weekend-long workshop covers both the generation-stage yogas (mandala Meditation, mantras, and color therapy) and completion-stage yogas (Tibetan kundalini practices) and includes hands-on immersion into the healing yogas. Part 1 of 6. You may view the entire series on our YouTube homepage under "Featured Playlists."

Complete DVD Set Available at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3082&search=Healing+through+Meditation&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Glenn Mullin - Death, Bardo & Enlightenment: Considerations from the Tibetan Book of the Dead
snippet.description:
Presented on February 2, 2016

Explore the esoteric meaning of dying, rebirth, and enlightenment in the Tibetan tradition. Believing that there is a continual birth and death of the mind from one moment to the next, Tibetan Buddhists recognize that when dreaming we are in a Bardo state and that the body and mind are then reborn into the waking state. The Tibetan Book of the Dead offers teachings that prepare us for the inevitable transformation, liberation, and a “successful” death.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3048&search=Death%2C+Bardo+&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Leslie Wolf - Islamic Spirituality: The Role of Religious Law
snippet.description:
Presented on January 28, 2016

The religion of Islam is more than 1,400 years old, and it has had an enormous impact on world civilization. Unfortunately, most Americans have little understanding of Islam, and media coverage of the religion is almost always sensationalist and superficial. Islamic law (sharia) remains especially misunderstood, despite its great importance both for Islam and Islamic countries. This presentation will provide an overview of Islamic law and the role it plays in Islamic spirituality. There will also be some discussion of religious law and spirituality in general.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3045&search=Islamic+Spirituality&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Terry Cronin - Common Ground: Christian & Buddhist Contemplative Practices
snippet.description:
Presented on January 21, 2016

What do you do when your child wakes up sick or frightened during the night? Is caring for your child a Christian or Buddhist response? At the time, does it matter to the child what you believe or what you do? What helps you to "see clearly and act well?" We'll look at how Christians and Buddhists use very similar techniques of contemplative prayer and meditation to help overcome their attachment to "I, my, me" and make their spiritual teachings a living part of their daily existence.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3042&search=Common+Ground%3A+Christian&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Ananya Rajan: The Limitless Potential of Being
snippet.description:
Presented on Jan. 14th, 2016

Verses from the Center, otherwise known as Mulamadhyamakakarika, is a text from the teachings of the sage Nagarjuna. The text explores the wisdom of emptiness, often described as the Middle Way by Buddhists. Emptiness' premise lies in the contingency or "interbeingness" of all life. By understanding and practicing emptiness we can begin to step back from the limits we set ourselves and see what we truly are.

Available soon on DVD.

snippet.title: Pablo Sender: The Power of Thought and Its Use
snippet.description:
Presented on December 10, 2015

Does our thinking affect our physical bodies? And can it affect the world "out there"? Many people believe that our thoughts are not merely the result of brain activity, but a real force with the ability to produce objective results. If so, how does it work? Theosophical teachings present a clear and systematic study of the hidden power inherent in our thinking. A deeper knowledge of our mental nature will help us master this important power to promote spiritual growth for ourselves and others.


*****************************
Learn more

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3037

Related materials 
The Power of Thought: A Twenty-First Century Adaptation of Annie Besant's Classic work, Thought Power by John Algeo, Shirley Nicholson - https://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=743

snippet.title: Bhante Sujatha - Be Your Own Best Friend: The Practice of Loving-Kindness
snippet.description:
Presented on December 3, 2015

Today many of us have the burning desire to love more deeply, live more fully, and find sustainable happiness, yet the happiness and peace we seek continues to remain out of reach. Until we authentically learn to love ourselves and become our own best friends, we will not achieve that happiness. The practice of loving-kindness meditation, when practiced with sincerity and commitment, can change the destiny of humanity. It's through our "self-love" that we are able to love the whole world.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3026&search=Be+Your+Own+Best+Friend&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Arthur George - Esoteric Christianity: The  Meaning of the Garden of Eden Story
snippet.description:
Presented on October 29, 2015

Myths are stories that convey through symbols sacred truths that are hard to express in words, making them esoteric or not easily grasped. The biblical Garden of Eden story is best understood from the standpoint of mythological studies, which Arthur and Elena George did in their recent award-winning book, "The Mythology of Eden." In this talk Arthur will explain the mythical symbolism in the story, the meaning of the knowledge of good and evil, and how early Christianity co-opted the story for its own purposes.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3013&search=The+Meaning+of+the+Garden+of+Eden+Story&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Richard Smoley: The Strange Identity of Jesus Christ
snippet.description:
Who was Jesus? This has been one of the main themes of theological debate for centuries. But the debate has obscured one basic fact about Jesus: who the first Christians actually thought he was. In this lecture, Richard Smoley will tie threads together from the Bible and ancient sources to show that in the earliest times, Jesus's followers thought he was someone quite different from what the church later taught. Presented on November 19, 2015.


*****************************
Learn more

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3023

snippet.title: Ray Grasse: Exploring the Astrological Universe
snippet.description:
Presented on October 8, 2015

In this lecture Ray Grasse presents a broad overview of astrology, from the personal to the cosmic--with side-trips into the dynamics of prediction, "Sun sign" astrology, the Aquarian Age,  transmuting difficult planetary patterns, synchronicity and symbolism, free will, archetypes, the 100th Monkey paradigm, the horoscope as "sheet music," and celebrities galore. Whether you're new to astrology or a long-term practitioner, you should find something to chew on here. Ray's new book is "Under a Sacred Sky: Essays on the Practice and Philosophy of Astrology" (Wessex, 2015), and his website is http://www.raygrasse.com.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3003&search=Exploring+the+Astrological+Universe&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: David Shiner - Faith and Practice: A Quaker Perspective
snippet.description:
Presented on November 5, 2015.

Although the Quaker religion has existed since the middle of the 17th century, the general public knows very little about it. Quakerism is based on the belief that "God's Will" can be known directly by every human being. In this lecture the history, beliefs, and practices of Quakers will be explained, with special focus placed on those aspects of Quakerism that are most relevant to life in the 21st century.

snippet.title: Don Myers - Taoist Neigong: The Internal Power of Tai Chi, Qigong, and Meditation
snippet.description:
Presented on October 22, 2015

Discovered and developed in antiquity by Taoist monks, the art and science of Neigong (internal energy development) is the root of all qi (energy) cultivation methods from China. There are 16 components of the neigong system, from the original Water Tradition lineage of Lao Tzu (Tao Te Ching), each having an in-depth field of study where specific techniques are learned separately, and then combined until they become integrated.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3009&search=Taoist+Neigong&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Santikaro - Samadhi: Mind Undistracted and Unhindered
snippet.description:
Presented on October 15, 2015.

In the spiritual life, and especially in meditation, we cultivate awareness that enables us to see more deeply and be less reactive with the vicissitudes of life. To facilitate this practice we also need to develop Samadhi, a single-tasking or one pointed concentration. This ability to focus attention requires that we learn to recognize and gradually overcome the many moods and distracting thoughts that are a hindrance to Samadhi.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3006&search=Samadhi%3A+Mind&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Radhanath Swami - The Journey Within: Unleashing the Power of the Soul
snippet.description:
Presented October 1, 2015.

Radhanath Swami, born as Richard Slavin in Chicago, came to confront a deep sense of alienation from the materialism and the civil injustices of mid-20th century America. Near-death encounters, apprenticeships with advanced yogis, and years of travel along the pilgrim's path led him to the inner sanctum of India's mystic culture. Now a monk in a Krishna-bhakti lineage and teacher of the devotional path of Bhakti Yoga, he is the author of "The Journey Home," a memoir of his search for spiritual truth.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=3000&search=The+Journey+Within%3A&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Russell FourEagles: Native American Healing Tradition
snippet.description:
Presented September 24, 2014.

Under the guidance of his Oneida grandmother, Russell FourEagles learned sacred Oneida cosmology myths, healing ceremonies, and traditions that have been handed down for generations. Using inspiring and personal stories from his book, "The Making of a Healer: Teachings of My Oneida Grandmother," he generously shares some of the old wisdom and practices in the hope that they are not forgotten.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2995&search=Native+American+Healing+Tradition&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: The Dalai Lama - Bridging the Faith Divide: A Public Talk by His Holiness
snippet.description:
Presented on July 17, 2011.

In July of 2011, the Theosophical Society in America invited the Dalai Lama to speak as part of the Society's annual summer convention. This program, which was given at the University of Illinois, was emceed by Bill Kurtis of WBBM-TV and includes performances by children of the Tibetan Alliance of Chicago and the Chicago Children’s Choir, with Josephine Lee, president and artistic director. The staging was conceived by and implemented under the direction of Jim Lasko of Redmoon Theater in collaboration with Chicago-land representatives of many of the world’s faith organizations.

theosophical.org

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: Ageless Wisdom in Daily Life
snippet.description:
Presented on September 17, 2015.

Many people have the sense that spiritual life and daily life are fundamentally separate. This way of seeing the world is an inheritance from both religious and secular thought. The Ageless Wisdom tradition describes the human being as both spirit and matter linked by mind. Its teachings provide a means to live in a way that harmonizes these very different dimensions of our being.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2994&search=Ageless+Wisdom+in+Daily+Life&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.description: A presentation of the 129th Summer National Convention of the Theosophical Society in America explores what psychology can tell us about the soul and in what ways, if any, it can help us on the spiritual path. 2015.

snippet.title: Alan Pritz: Paramahansa Yogananda - Meditation Master for the New Millennium
snippet.description: Paramahansa Yogananda was a great spiritual teacher who inspired many people throughout the world. Alan Pritz, author of "Meditation as a Way of Life: Philosophy and Practice Rooted in the Teachings of Paramahansa Yogananda," will introduce us to the life, mission and teachings of Yoganada and explain how we can use his principles and practices to help deepen our inner relationship with Spirit. The evening will close with devotional kirtan chants and a guided meditation. 2015.

snippet.title: David Peters: Korean Zen and "Don't-Know" Mind
snippet.description: The teachings of Korean Zen are simple, clear, and direct, offering a path to the transformation of body, heart, and mind. The central technique is to deeply cultivate the question "What is this?" and then look directly into the mind of not-knowing. To clearly perceive this "don't-know mind" or "before-thinking mind" is itself enlightenment. David will also share personal stories from his book, "Who Is Singing in Chinese? Notes from a 100-Year Zen Retreat." 2015.

snippet.title: Vimala Bhikkhuni: Taming the Thinking Mind
snippet.description: Buddhism teaches that it is necessary to tame the "monkey mind" in order to experience more peace, contentment, and clarity in life. Using gentle meditation techniques we can explore the nature of our minds, begin to recognize habitual thought patterns, and free ourselves from the negative tendencies. When we see the benefit of this practice, we will want to make meditation a regular part of our lives. 2015.

snippet.title: Ed Abdill: In Their Own Words - Wisdom from the Mahatmas
snippet.description: Who are the Masters of Wisdom about whom we hear so much? In his new book on the Masters Ed Abdill brings them to life, shattering many misconceptions by allowing them to speak from their letters revealing who they are and what differentiates them from the average person. In their own words, they present some of their most important teachings, including their views on death and reincarnation, karma, and science. Ed Abdill is author of "The Secret Gateway–Modern Theosophy and the Ancient Wisdom Tradition" and "Masters of Wisdom: The Mahatmas, Their Letters, and The Path" (May 2015). 2015.

snippet.title: Don Hoes: The Mystic Journey of Inner Light, Healing and Love
snippet.description:
Travel along on the Soul's Journey through inner light and visit the mystical realms described by Madame Blavatsky. Learn how research and quantum scientists have verified that light and vibration are the source of all existence and discover how this inner energy can be tapped into for healing. Hear accounts that verify its working from those who have had out of body experiences (NDEs and ALEs) as well as those who meditate on this inner light. 2015.

snippet.title: Pablo Sender: An Esoteric Approach to Happiness
snippet.description: Everyone is searching for happiness. Some think it can be achieved through acquiring possessions, power, or position, but many have found that this is not true. Others believe that spirituality can lead them to happiness, only to discover that a spiritual discipline frequently implies effort, inner conflict, and renunciation. So, many wonder—What is happiness? And is it attainable at all? Explore the nature of happiness from an esoteric perspective and discover how it can flower in daily life. 2015.

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: Cultivating the Inner Advantage
snippet.description:
Awareness gives us the ability to navigate through the world with a sense of ease. Those who have made some progress along this path manifest a certain quality that we easily recognize. This awareness is not a genetic inheritance or a gift from on high, but something that needs to be consciously cultivated. Most traditions regard meditation as the paramount tool for cultivating awareness and the understanding that arises from exploring our inner worlds. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2925&search=Cultivating&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.description:
Emotions—like thoughts, memories, hopes, and breath—course through us like a sustaining stream. The Taoist idea is to learn to live in harmony with the stream. The metaphor of water offers a method to see our emotions not as blockages, distractions, or who we are, but as fluid, dynamic, and always changing. We can learn to navigate this stream, befriend emotions, transform thoughts, and ultimately see beyond the turbulence of life. 2015.

snippet.title: John Cianciosi: Freedom from Anxiety and Worry
snippet.description:
It has been said that worrying is like running around in a circle—getting us nowhere. Why do so many of us spend so much time worrying about so many things? Is it possible to live responsible and caring lives without falling victim to anxiety and worry? That a human being can be free of such negative emotions is central to the Buddha's teaching. However, it is necessary to understanding the nature of the human condition and come to terms with reality in order to free ourselves. 2015.

snippet.description:
Forgiveness is praised more than it's practiced. Why should we forgive? When? Are there times when it's not right to forgive? How can you tell forgiving from condoning? Richard Smoley, editor of "Quest magazine," offers some insights from his new book "The Deal: A Guide to Radical and Complete Forgiveness." 2015.

snippet.title: Santikaro - Seeing Clearly: The Buddhist Practice of Mindfulness
snippet.description:
Our thoughts, conceptions, theories, and beliefs often drift into “thickets of views” that can lead to confusion and rigidity. One way to ground ourselves amidst the modern conceptual bombardment is to cultivate mindful inquiry of basic experiential realities: the sense doors, sensory experience, and how they feel. Wisdom can arise when we see these things clearly, and we understand the limitations of all those concepts, theories, and beliefs. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2909&search=Seeing+Clearly&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Frank Morales: Discovering the Meaning and Wisdom of Life Passages
snippet.description:
Using the astrological teachings of Dane Rudyar (Rhythm of Wholeness) and Alexander Ruperti (Cycles of Becoming) as resources for understanding psychological spiritual growth, we find they reveal the timing coordination for patterns of growth as we age. Elements of developmental psychology will be explored and sequenced with their astrological triggers. Investigate your own life purpose with regard to these perspectives to find greater clarity of life’s path. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2880&search=Discovering+the+Meaning+and+Wisdom&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: George Bond - The Buddha and Jesus: Spiritual Masters
snippet.description:
The Buddha and Jesus have been described as enlightened persons who realized their spiritual visions. They gave rise to two of the world’s major religious traditions, and became virtually deified by their followers. But who were they, and what were their spiritual visions? Explore the historical identities of these two spiritual teachers, the nature of their paths to ultimate truth, and consider the similarities and differences of their views of the human condition and subsequent teachings. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2877&search=The+Buddha+and+Jesus%3A+Spiritual+Masters&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Pablo Sender - Akashic Records: A Theosophical View
snippet.description:
The term "Akashic Records" was a term coined by 19th century Theosophists to refer to impressions of past events that are said to exist on non-physical planes. On these planes, the clairvoyant can find a record of the earth's history as well as the past life history of individuals. Early Theosophists systematically studied this "memory of nature" and described the subject in a scientific manner, providing a sound explanation of how these visions are recorded and how they can be accessed. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2875&search=Akashic+Records&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Glenn Mullin - The Way of the Shaman: Ancient Wisdom of the Mongol Healers
snippet.description:
Mongolian shamanism is one of the world’s most ancient traditions. Anthropologists believe that it came to the Americas with the earliest wave of migration across the Bering Strait. Mongolian shamans today very closely resemble the medicine men of the native tribes of the American Southwest, especially the Apache and Navaho. In this lecture, Nakpa Glenn will share some of the primordial wisdom carried by these men and women of knowledge. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2870&search=The+Way+of+the+Shaman&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Barbara Hebert - Perspectives from C.G. Jung: A Guide to Traveling the Spiritual Path
snippet.description:
Carl Jung synthesized many aspects of Eastern and Western thought and introduced new and different perspectives impacting philosophers, folklorists, and writers as well as psychologists and psychiatrists. Some of Jung's more famous statements can be used as guideposts in traveling the spiritual path and increasing spiritual awareness. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2859&search=Perspectives+from+C&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: The Present Need
snippet.description:
For the past few hundred years a cycle of human activity has been building. The dominance of a new way of seeing and experiencing the world has been the driving force leading to this time. In the words of Mircea Eliade, "The completely profane world, the wholly desacralized cosmos, is a recent discovery in the history of human spirit." This approach to living in the world has produced a cascading series of problems including degradation of the environment, global violence, and personal unease. What can we do? How do we respond to the present need? 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2867&search=The+Present+Need&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Lydia Van den Broeck: Master Your Energy - Protect Yourself from Energy Vampires
snippet.description:
There are some people who are “Energy Vampires” and they drain you of energy. You will feel a sense of disempowerment when in their company or even when just thinking about them. How do you protect yourself from these toxic people found in your immediate environment? You need to repair that energy drain in the lower chakras if you want to manifest your Soul Desires. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2882&search=Master+Your+Energy&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Dan Hooper: Philosophy Meets Quantum Mechanics
snippet.description:
Scientists agree that quantum mechanics is an incredibly successful theory, making accurate predictions for a huge variety of phenomena. However, there is much less consensus regarding the question of what this theory means about the universe. Does quantum mechanics imply the existence of many worlds? Is there a special role that is played by consciousness? Dr. Hooper discusses the various philosophical implications of this rather bizarre and incredible theory. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2862&search=Philosophy+Meets+Quantum+Mechanics&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Juliana Cesano: In Search of a Genuine Spiritual Practice
snippet.description:
Many paths, books, and methods that are available today promise the key to happiness and the achievement of everything we want, but not necessarily a genuine spiritual unfoldment. How can we distinguish between a practice of value and one that is mere entertainment? By exploring the teachings of the ancient wisdom tradition we can develop an authentic everyday practice for ourselves.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2893&search=In+Search+of+a+Genuine+Spiritual+Practice&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Dave Gunning: Spiritual Astrology
snippet.description:
People familiar with the planets in standard astrology have a basic understanding of their symbolic meaning. In past-life astrology the planets take on a deeper spiritual meaning that resonates with man's Soul. The exoteric (outer) and esoteric (inner) meaning of the planets and their connection to the signs they rule will be discussed. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2889&search=+Spiritual+Astrology&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Geshe Pema Dorjee: Tame the Mind and Free the Heart
snippet.description:
Our mind is the source of both happiness and suffering. The only tool we have with which to tame our mind is the mind itself. Geshe Pema Dorjee will describe how suffering is caused by our destructive emotions and discuss techniques that can be used to transform negative attitudes and ways of thinking. He will also describe methods that free the heart and foster the experience of universal love and compassion. 2015.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2886&search=Tame+the+Mind&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: The Mahatmas and Their Letters | Theosophical Classic 2010
snippet.description:
This video is part of the Theosophical Society in America’s Classics Series.

Many of the core teachings of Theosophy are found in the letters written by two Masters of Wisdom to one of the early and prominent members of the Theosophical Society, Alfred P. Sinnett, then an editor for an English newspaper in India. These letters, which were held for many years in the British Museum and today are housed in the British Library, are extremely significant to Theosophists for two reasons: their metaphysical and philosophical content and the extraordinary methods used in their production. This video gives the historical background of the Mahatma Letters, discusses the phenomenal aspects of their production, and comments on their subsequent impact on the Theosophical Society. Presented in 2010.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2405&search=Mahatmas+and+Their+Letters&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.description:
What are the benefits of reflecting on our life stories? There are various practices that engage both the right and left sides of our brains that aid us as we look back. While envisioning a new chapter, as well as the possible obstacles encountered bringing it into being, learn about using Jungian and shamanic practices to engage transpersonal realms to gain energy and information to fuel a new chapter in that story. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/search&search=Change%20Your%20Story&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.description:
The Essenes, a mysterious group that flourished around the time of Christ, have been the source of much curiosity. Were they the adepts that taught Jesus? Jewish extremists? The forebears of the New Age? In this talk, Richard Smoley explores the history and the background of the Essenes and puts some myths to rest. 2014.

Students of esoteric lore owe a deep debt of gratitude to those brave souls who kept the wisdom tradition alive by demonstrating “dauntless courage” and “a courageous endurance of personal injustice.” From Socrates and Hypatia of Alexandria to Giordano Bruno and Mme. Blavatsky, these sturdy souls paid a heavy price while paving the way for others. 2014.

Listen to the old wisdom and practices of the Oneida Nation that Russell FourEagles hopes are not forgotten. He’ll recount sacred Oneida myths and cosmology, describe healing ceremonies and traditions that have been handed down for generations and taught to him by his grandmother, and share his own inspiring and personal stories regarding how his book on these subjects came to be written. 2014.

snippet.title: Atala Dorothy Toy: Earth's Interdimensional Life-Forms and Nature Spirits
snippet.description:
Trees and rocks hold energy in place for all on earth to enjoy—that includes humans, nature spirits, and E.T.s. Not moving very fast and maturing slowly, they embody the experiences and energies they are meant to work with. With careful observation, these energies can be understood. Learn about the global network of earth-energy these life-forms link into and view images of these inter-dimensional life forms through Power-Point slides. 2012.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=1997&search=Earth%27s&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.description:
Gain a new perspective about what Western societies consider ghosts, spirits, and the paranormal as we look into how spirits are understood globally and the social roles they play in various cultures. Discover how pop culture has defined the role of a paranormal investigator and ghost hunting in the United States. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2709&search=Ghost&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Alice O. Howell: Stars, Cycles, and Psyche - Psychological Aspects of Astrology
snippet.description:
The great Alice O. Howell passed away on October 28, 2014, and those of us who were privileged to know her remember not only her wise teachings but her generous soul. Born on November 13, 1922, she traveled widely around the world over the course of her life, taught and lectured extensively (including at many Jungian centers--which is where I first came into contact with her), and published nine books in all. I interviewed her on video for the Theosophical Society in 1991—and in commemoration of her passing, they've chosen to make those videos freely available online. In this video Alice combines her extensive knowledge of astrology with the insights of Swiss psychologist Carl Jung, reclaiming its importance as a key toward understanding ourselves and the world. --Ray Grasse

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2140&search=Stars%2C+Cycles&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Alice O. Howell: The Dove in the Stone - Finding the Sacred in the Commonplace
snippet.description:
The great Alice O. Howell passed away on October 28, 2014, and those of us who were privileged to know her remember not only her wise teachings but her generous soul. Born on November 13, 1922, she traveled widely around the world over the course of her life, taught and lectured extensively (including at many Jungian centers--which is where I first came into contact with her), and published nine books in all. I interviewed her on video for the Theosophical Society in 1991—and in commemoration of her passing, they've chosen to make her videos freely available online. This video features her discussing the act of finding the sacred in the commonplace, the legendary Isle of Iona, and the value of symbolism, among other topics. --Ray Grasse

snippet.description:
According to yogic tradition, Kundalini is the spiritual force that lies dormant in every human being. Once awakened, often through meditation and yoga practices, it rises up the spine and finds expression in the form of spiritual knowledge, mystical vision, psychic powers, and ultimately, enlightenment. Learn about traditional, Theosophical, and modern medical perspectives of Kundalini, as well as historical figures who have awakened the energy. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2703&search=Kundalini+Awakening&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Mira Kelley: Beyond Past Lives
snippet.description:
Learn about the nature of time, karma, destiny, free will, and how each choice made creates a new reality. Sharing the life-changing lessons that she and her clients have learned through past life regression, Mira Kelley will help you understand how to heal your body, mind, and spirit. snippet.description:
Annie Besant was a passionate advocate of the Third Object of the TS, which involves the exploration of unknown laws of nature and the spiritual powers latent in humanity. Based on Madame Blavatsky's esoteric teachings, Besant developed a set of principles designed for safely pursuing this Object. Differentiating between occultists, who pursue psychic development, and mystics, who pursue spiritual unfoldment, she provides guidance and support for whichever path we may be called to follow. 2014.

snippet.title: Ajahn Viradhammo: Awakening to the Way Things Are
snippet.description:
The word Buddha means the awakened one and we can all awaken to the reality of existence. Speaker and Buddhist practitioner Ajahn Viradhammo suggests that truth is not a secret that needs to be revealed to us by someone else. The Buddha said that it is imminent, timeless, and to be realized directly by oneself. The mind blinded by delusion does not see that truth, but it is possible to cultivate the path that allows us to penetrate through the veil of appearance and realize the truth of "The Way Things Are." This is the path to freedom and peace. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2632&search=Awakening+to+the+Way+Things&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Tim Boyd: A Convergence of Wisdom
snippet.description:
Zen master Shunryo Susuki made the statement that "In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's there are few." Modern times have been characterized by an ever-increasing specialization of knowledge to a point where even within fields of medicine, physics, philosophy, religion, and the arts, meaningful contact is difficult. The president of The Theosophical Society, Tim Boyd, suggests that the ageless wisdom tradition asserts the possibility of a unity among the various approaches, which can lead to an understanding that lies beyond knowledge. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2692&search=A+Convergence+of+Wisdom&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Shuddhaanandaa Bramachari: Mindfulness Meditation for Health and Happiness
snippet.description:
The purpose of mindful meditation, suggests speaker Shuddhaanandaa Bramachari, is not to achieve anything, but to reach a state of letting go, a profound state of relaxation. It is our willingness to do nothing, to just be with the self, in silence, without any external support. It is in this powerful state of mind and stillness that great innovations and creative genius may happen. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2689&search=Mindfulness+Meditation&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

In this program, Dr. Alexander(Proof of Heaven) continues his discussion of why he believes that his near-death experience is totally consistent with the leading edges of scientific understanding today.
2014.

snippet.title: Eben Alexander: A Neurosurgeon's Journey through the Afterlife
snippet.description:
In this intimate and powerful re-examination of his best-selling book "Proof of Heaven," Dr. Alexander looks at the past two and a half years of his life spent in trying to reconcile his rich spiritual experience with contemporary physics and cosmology. He is convinced that his remarkable near-death journey is totally consistent with the leading edges of scientific understanding today. 2014.

Want more? Join Eben Alexander for an experiential on-demand workshop with insights, discussion, guided meditation, and heart activation to explore the soul’s journey through its process of rebirth, life, and the afterlife.

Learn more here: https://vimeo.com/manage/videos/641284276

snippet.title: A Sinner's Semester: A Fundamental Education with Ron Miller | Theosophical Classic 2010
snippet.description:
This video is part of the Theosophical Society in America’s Classics Series.

What happens when a mildly committed Quaker from Brown University spends a semester at Liberty University in Lynchburg, Virginia—a university created by Jerry Falwell as a center for teaching fundamentalist Christianity? 

Professor Ronald H. Miller was a frequent guest lecturer of the Theosophical Society in America, spreading his message of religious tolerance and interreligious dialogue whenever he spoke. He was a professor of the Religion Department at Lake Forest College in Illinois and was a co-founder and co-director of Common Ground, an active adult education group for interfaith study and dialogue founded in 1975. Miller was vice-president of the Interreligious Engagement Project 21 and Board member at Hands-of-Peace, an organization that brings American, and Palestinian and Israeli teenagers from the Middle East together for a two-week program in the United States.

This was Professor Miller's second to last presentation at the Theosophical Society, before his sudden and unexpected death on May 4th, 2011. He was 73 years old.  Presented in 2010.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2144&search=Sinner%27s+Semester&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Ron Miller: A Very Different Christian Story
snippet.description:
Most people assume Christianity began as a unified movement and then fragmented in the course of its history. As Professor Miller points out, however, diversity was present from the beginning, as evidenced by ancient texts found buried in the deserts of Egypt. April, 2011.

Professor Ronald H. Miller was a frequent guest lecturer of the Theosophical Society in America, spreading his message of religious tolerance and interreligious dialogue whenever he spoke. He was a professor of the Religion Department at Lake Forest College in Illinois and was a co-founder and co-director of Common Ground, an active adult education group for interfaith study and dialogue founded in 1975. Miller was vice-president of the Interreligious Engagement Project 21 and Board member at Hands-of-Peace, an organization that brings American, and Palestinian and Israeli teenagers from the Middle East together for a two-week program in the United States.

This was Professor Miller's last presentation at the Theosophical Society when, only a few days later, on May 4th, 2011, he died suddenly and unexpectedly of a heart arrhythmia. He was 73 years old.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2220&search=Very+Different+Christian&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Andrew Vidich: Spiritual Resurrection--Becoming Beings of Love and Light
snippet.description:
Each one of us must eventually leave this material world to journey onward to the spirit realm. Speaker Andrew Vidich explores the true meaning of resurrection? Through meditation and appropriate guidance, we can learn how to fly heavenward on the wings of our "light body." The true meaning of resurrection is to become what we already are: beings of love and light. Become a living embodiment of the resurrection. 2014.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2571&search=Spiritual+Resurrection&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: Pablo Sender: Enlightenment! Sudden or Gradual?
snippet.description:
When we speak of "enlightenment," what may come to mind is the image of a light bulb within us suddenly switching on, illuminating the darkness of our delusions with the all-pervading light of wisdom. This experience happens suddenly and with a sense of great surprise and wonder. But does enlightenment always occur suddenly? Is there a gradual process of spiritual unfolding that comes about as a result of cultivating a path of training?

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2563&search=Enlightenment%21&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: William Meader: The Evolving Soul of Humanity
snippet.description:
Crisis is a prerequisite to spiritual transformation. The present crisis facing humanity is an indication that a great transformational opportunity is approaching. The Soul of Humanity is in the process of awakening, and global crisis is its forerunner. Speaker William Meader explores spiritual approaches that can support humanity's transition into a brighter future. 2014.

snippet.title: Make Me an Instrument of Your Peace with Gabriele Uhlein | Theosophical Classic 2013
snippet.description:
In this talk, Sister Gabriele Uhlein explores the amazing encounter of St. Francis of Assisi and the Sultan, Malek al Kamil during the violence of the crusades. In 1219, during the Fifth Crusade, St. Francis was escorted by Muslim soldiers to the Sultan. There he met Sufi teachers and returned dramatically changed in his relationship to Islam and in his prayer-life. Experience this fascinating story as both historical fact and as spiritual allegory. It is the tale of how a quest to be of service can dare us to cross spiritual thresholds, to encounter the fearsome stranger, and forever change our hearts. A presentation of the 127th summer national convention of the Theosophical Society in America. 2013.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2466&search=Make+Me+an+Instrument&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true
