snippet.description: 2013 International Theosophical Order of Service Conference prepared a greeting message to members around the world. This conference took place July 23-26th 2013 at the Theosophical Society in America headquarters in Wheaton, IL. You can find out more information about what the TOS is doing around the world by visiting http://international.theoservice.org/

snippet.title: Adyar: Home of the Theosophical Society
snippet.description:
This documentary explores the international Theosophical Society in Adyar, Chennai, India; and examines some of the reasons that founders H. P. Blavatsky and Col. Henry Steel Olcott might have had for moving the Society's headquarters from the United States to India. Rare film footage and archival photos highlight the program along with appearances by leading members of the Society, including international Theosophical Society president, Radha Burnier, Theosophical scholar and historian Michael Gomes, and more. Updated for 2012. 57 minutes.

Closed Captions: English

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=1187&search=Adyar%3A+Home+of+the&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: The Theosophical Society in America: An Illustrated History
snippet.description:
This recently updated documentary celebrates over 135 years of Theosophy in America, beginning with the early history of the Theosophical Society, and highlighting the important contributions made by H. P. Blavatsky and Col. Henry Olcott in the formation of the Society. Rare film footage and archival photos highlight the video along with appearances by such Theosophical Society in America presidents as Joy Mills, Dora Kunz, John Algeo, Tim Boyd, and International Theosophical Society president, Radha Burnier. Revised and updated for 2012. Narrated by actor Paul Meier. 49 minutes.


Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=1175&search=Theosophical+Society+in+America&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true&page=2

snippet.title: Pop-Theosophy: Spirituality in Graphic Novels
snippet.description:
The great mythologist Joseph Campbell taught that when the hero myth is applied to spiritual epics, the hero's cycle or journey almost always culminates in "apotheosis," a Greek term meaning "to deify" or "make divine." In a similar manner, this PowerPoint presentation explores the concept of apotheosis, in the form of graphic novels, by such writers as Alan Moore, Aranovsky, and de Matteis. Learn how these modern-day spiritual epics give instruction on Theosophy or the attainment of "divine wisdom." 2013. 49 minutes.

Available on DVD at: http://questbooks.com/index.php?route=product/product&product_id=2431&search=Pop+Theosophy&description=true&category_id=59&sub_category=true

snippet.title: The Theosophical Society in America: A Brief Tour
snippet.description:
Tim Boyd, former national president and current international president of the Theosophical Society, explores the American Section headquarters, as well as, its purpose and goals. A great introduction for anyone wanting to know more about what goes on here. For more information visit theosophical.org.

Closed captioning available in both English and Spanish.

snippet.description: The international president of the Theosophical Society talks candidly about the Society's efforts over the years at this impromptu gathering of staff members and volunteers of the Theosophical Society in America.

snippet.title: Joy Mills: A Memoir of Joy
snippet.description: Joy Mills remembers how her quest for truth as a young women led her to a lifetime of devotion to the work of the Theosophical Society and the study of Theosophy. Joy has served in a number of capacities, including that of National President of both the American and Australian Sections of the society, as well as International Vice-President. Her lecture tours have taken her to more than 50 countries. She has published several books, including a history of the American section of the Theosophical Society, and her writings have been published in theosophical journals throughout the world.

snippet.title: John Shelby Spong: Healing Our Religious Wounds (preview)
snippet.description:
Talk by Bishop John Shelby Spong - http://www.johnshelbyspong.com/

As an activist, speaker, and author, Bishop John Shelby Spong is an outspoken advocate for church reform. He shares a message of life based on love not hate, inclusion rather than exclusion, opportunity not discrimination, and intelligent, questioning faith rather than blind belief. The topic for the first part of this program is "Religious Wounds: The Power of Guilt." Part two is "Religious Healing: The Power of Wholeness." 2010.

snippet.title: M. Kelley Hunter: Lilith--The Cosmic Feminine (preview)
snippet.description:
Talk by M. Kelley Hunter - http://www.heliastar.com/

Renewed interest in the goddess has brought many faces of the divine feminine into modern awareness. Lilith is one of the most alluring. If we also follow her trail back in time  we often discover, not only a major shift in the collective human image of the feminine, but also something essential that needs to be redeemed in our personal lives. Lilith is also the name given to four astronomical points - an asteroid, a star, a dark "ghost" moon, and the better-known Black Moon. 86 minutes. 2009.
